title: How to Make Roasted Paprika Almonds

steps.headline: Place a layer of baking paper across a baking tray or cookie sheet.
Arrange the almonds on the tray.
steps.description: Make sure that the almonds are not sitting on top of each other.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Dry roast for 25 minutes or until they appear golden brown in colour.

steps.headline: Take the almonds out and pour into a bowl.
steps.description: Pour in olive oil, add paprika and salt. Mix well.

steps.headline: Put back on the baking tray evenly.
steps.description: Put back into the oven for two - three minutes to set the seasoning and allow the almonds to dry.

text: Preheat the oven to 150ºC/300ºF.  Place a layer of baking paper across a baking tray or cookie sheet.  Arrange the almonds on the tray. Make sure that the almonds are not sitting on top of each other. Place in the oven. Dry roast for 25 minutes or until they appear golden brown in colour. Take the almonds out and pour into a bowl. Pour in olive oil, add paprika and salt. Mix well. Put back on the baking tray evenly. Put back into the oven for two - three minutes to set the seasoning and allow the almonds to dry.
